item.title: Report X-2024050285
item.description:
Report X-2024050285

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-09T15:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DURING SIX-SIDED CHECK AN AIR PACKAGE WAS OPENED FOR INSPECTION DUE TO UNKNOWN MARKINGS BEING COVERED WITH SPRAY PAINT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED EIGHT LAPTOPS CONTAINING LITHIUM ION BATTERIES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THE PACKAGE APPEARS TO HAVE BEEN DROPPED OFF AT THE UPS STORE #3065 IN CATHEDRAL CITY, CA AND SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER RX3153, SELL YOUR CELL LLC, 74855 JONI DRIVE, SUITE 4, PALM DESERT CA 92260.

item.title: Report X-2024050151
item.description:
Report X-2024050151

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: Hodgkins
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1510
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PPRX 663916 was found in the BNSF Railway Hogkins yard leaking from the top of the car when the car was moved. Upon inspection, it was determined that PPRX 663916 was leaking from the manway and released approximately 1 gallon of product. A BNSF contractor was dispatched, inspected the car and found the manway gasket deteriorated and one of 6 manway swing bolts less than tool tight. The contractor installed a new manway gasket, properly secured the car and BNSF released it to destination.

item.title: Report E-2024050036
item.description:
Report E-2024050036

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-08T15:12:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-25
  • City: DANVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 25, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured in transit and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer interior and terminal yard. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN12-impacted trailer and terminal yard. All impacted material was collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums. The drums of waste and the damaged drum were staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-07T15:13:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: Chicago
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: QATAR AIRWAYS CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 157-34721562 ORD/DXB Total 9 Pcs/ 894.5 Kgs Shipment was not booked as RBI and shipment is booked on QR726/02MAY2024, a passenger aircraft and it was tendered at Qatar Airways facility. Also the commodity in MAWB indicated"Consolidation" without any lithium battery statement. Cargo piece is on hold at the Qatar Airways Cargo facility and advised Shipper of undeclared battery in MAWB. Shipper is picking up 2pcs out of 9 with the same HAWB with the RBI UN3480.

item.title: Report X-2024050121
item.description:
Report X-2024050121

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: n/aLarge fully regulated hazmat containing 4 plastic one gallon of chlorine oxidizer. The box was wet from the bottom due to one of the gallons having a large crack on the body and spilling all of liquid inside. Stained other gallons and are not safe to transport. Hazmat was called damaged from the loading side of the station but prior to that, the hazmat was processed in the unload side of the station and it was not damaged at the time, so I am assuming that the hazmat was not handled properly and with care again when moving hazmat from either unload or load side.

item.title: Report E-2024050019
item.description:
Report E-2024050019

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 20ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and 3ft-by-3ft area of the concrete dock and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Hepaco personnel stated that terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to their arrival. Additional granular absorbents were deployed by the contractor. The spent material was recovered and placed into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024050007
item.description:
Report E-2024050007

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-06T15:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: EAST PEORIA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 6ft-by-4ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to pinhole puncture on one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Clean Harbors personnel stated that Dayton Freight terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to their arrival. Clean Harbors personnel deployed additional absorbents and transferred the remaining material from the damaged tote to a new tote. The spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The empty poly tote and generated waste was staged onsite in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024050072
item.description:
Report X-2024050072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-03T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-30
  • City: CAROL STREAM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Large fully regulated hazmat containing 4 plastic one gallon of chlorine oxidizer. The box was wet on the bottom from one of the gallons having a large crack from the top to the bottom, spilling all of liquid inside. Stained other hazmat's as well and are not safe to transport. Hazmat was processed in the unload area and then was called out from the loading area as a damage. Hazmat seems to not have been handled carefully as it was being moved to be loaded. Also, shipper did not contain enough inner packaging to help hazmat as well.
